About: The World Aquatics Championships is the most important swimming competition held under the auspices of the International Swimming Federation. The World Swimming Championships have been held every 2, 3 or 4 years, depending on the international calendar, since 1973.

Abu Dhabi to host the World Swimming Championships and the International Aquatics Conference December 2022 ,It is held at the Etihad Arena with the participation of elite swimmers The official emblem of the 2022 FINA World Championships Short Distance (25 metres) revealed

The Abu Dhabi Sports Council announced the joining of a new group of elite swimmers from North America, Europe, Africa and the Asia-Pacific region, to participate in the 15th edition of the 2022 World Swimming Championships for short distances (25 meters) scheduled at the Federation Arena on Yas Island from 16 to 21 next December.

Brazilian Ana Marcela Cunha won the gold in the 10km marathon at the Tokyo Olympics, on Wednesday morning, after finishing the race in less than two hours.

The family of Tunisian swimmer Ahmed El Hefnawy documented the atmosphere of their hysterical celebrations by crowning their young son with the gold medal in the swimming competition at dawn today, Sunday, at the Tokyo Olympics.
